programme.title: Sports Life
programme.desc: Sports Life explores the world of sport, bringing you updates, interviews and reports from across the globe. Sport has the power to break down barriers, improve lives, connect communities, and of course, improve health. The show delves into all aspects of sport, from professionals competing at the very top to everyday individuals simply enjoying a pastime, demonstrating how sport and life are regularly connected.

programme.title: Projekt Zukunft
programme.desc: Science show on DW provides its viewers a weekly dose of useful scientific information regarding various areas. If you are into cosmos and universe, then this show is made for you. Find out if it is possible to predict solar storms, whether plants are smart, if synthetic fuels can help protect environment, what are the results of the largest-ever polar expedition, and many more questions in different spheres of life.

programme.title: DW News

programme.title: DW Shift
programme.desc: Can I use blockchain technology? Will artificial intelligence take over my career? What exactly is "Machine Learning"? These are some of the questions "SHIFT – Living in the Digital Age" tries to answer. The program focuses on a single topic – in depth and in detail. We talk to experts, present the key facts and explain complicated subjects in a simple manner. SHIFT – substantial, never superficial.

programme.title: Eco Africa
programme.desc: Eco Africa highlights the innovative and inspiring projects from across Africa and Europe that are being put into practice in a a bid to tackle climate change and support our depleting environments. In Africa especially, huge numbers of animal and wildlife species have dramatically fallen, largely due to a vast increase in human population across the continent. The increasing population is taking over vast swathes of natural land and in turn, adding to the demand for natural resources. This series explores the different concepts being used to help sustain our future, such as alternative resources, biodiversity conservation and the future of travel.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: DW News is news and information channel from a German international broadcaster Deutsche Well (German Wall). It provides latest news from Europe and all around the world in several languages on a daily basis. The service is transmitted worldwide via satellite with a reach of more than 197 million people on a weekly basis. Their motto is Made for minds. DW news is informative, entertaining, up-to-date and what is even more important, reliable source of news, the content is intended to be independent of government influence.

programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.desc: 77 per cent of Africas population are below the age of thirty-five yet their interests are under-represented poltically and economically. This show aims to redress the balance by providing a voice to the largest demographic group on the continent. These dynamic younger people are politically engaged and will determine the future path their countries, and the continent as a whole, will follow in the twenty-first century. Presented by Eddy Micah Jr. from Ghana and Wanjiku Mwaura from Kenya, the show promotes a pan-African agenda by encouraging dialogue between the various interested parties. The show pulls no punches when delivering its compelling reports, personal accounts and provocative discussions. A long overdue look at the big issues that affect the youth of Africa.

programme.title: A Gold Rush in Space - The Business of Space Travel
programme.desc: Astrophysicist Gernot Gromer wants to promote space travel. So he founded the Austrian Space Forum. Gromer sees himself as a "shipbuilder" whos working on making the journey to Mars possible in 20 to 30 years. To this end- he conducts analog missions here on Earth. For these- scientists known as analog astronauts practice for the journey to the Red Planet- collecting knowledge along the way. AMADEE-24 is the name of the current mission- which will take place in 2024 in cooperation with the Armenian Space Agency in the Ararat region- an environment with Mars-like geology. The film accompanies the mission through its highs and lows

programme.title: We Come from the Cedar Tree - Life in Canadas Great Bear Rainforest

programme.title: Rev
programme.desc: New thinking and technology are revolutionizing our cars, our cities, our way of life. Rev doesnt just want to know how fast we get from A to B, but how we get there as well. programme.title: Eco Africa
programme.desc: Eco Africa highlights the innovative and inspiring projects from across Africa and Europe that are being put into practice in a a bid to tackle climate change and support our depleting environments. The increasing population is taking over vast swathes of natural land and in turn, adding to the demand for natural resources. This series explores the different concepts being used to help sustain our future, such as alternative resources, biodiversity conservation and the future of travel.

programme.title: The 77 Percent
programme.desc: 77 per cent of Africas population are below the age of thirty-five yet their interests are under-represented poltically and economically. This show aims to redress the balance by providing a voice to the largest demographic group on the continent. These dynamic younger people are politically engaged and will determine the future path their countries, and the continent as a whole, will follow in the twenty-first century. Presented by Eddy Micah Jr. from Ghana and Wanjiku Mwaura from Kenya, the show promotes a pan-African agenda by encouraging dialogue between the various interested parties. The show pulls no punches when delivering its compelling reports, personal accounts and provocative discussions. A long overdue look at the big issues that affect the youth of Africa.

programme.title: Border Control
programme.desc: The security and customs services at the border of Sweden are on constant watch to stop illegal items entering the country. Its their job to detect crime.

programme.title: Border Control
programme.desc: Alex receives a tip about a man acting suspiciously at Arlanda. Mimmi and Olivia gets a live surprise when opening a foul-smelling bag.

programme.title: Elukoha paastmine
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Harpoon Hunters
programme.desc: A crew of elite fishermen harpoon bluefin tuna off the shores of the Northeastern U.S. The race is on in a hunt that could reel in a fortune.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Expert craftsmen are bringing Drew Pritchards finds back to life and restore them to their former glory. Drew hunts for treasures such as derelict gems and forgotten remnants across the country. And then he and his team do the restoration turning trash to gold, so that worn objects become shining gems for which Drews customers want to pay a lot of money. All kinds of items can and will be restored, starting from a century-old suitcase to an ancient coffee machine, from a ravaged carousel horse to a large railway clock.

programme.title: Automuujad
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Kuidas see tehtud on?
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: Aardekutid
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland travel across the United Kingdom to uncover classic cars to buy, restore and sell on for a profit. The pair scour garages, barns and facilities to discover collectible cars which include the likes of the Morris Minor Traveller, Jaguar XJS, Rover P6 and a BMW 635 CSI among many others. The combination of Drews expertise of negotiation and deal-making and Pauls extensive mechanical knowledge makes them a formidable team ready to tackle anything challenging that comes their way.

programme.title: Kõige ohtlikum saak
programme.desc: A documentary chronicling real life the adventures of one of the most deadliest professions in the world. Follow Alaskan crab fishermen as they face 40-foot waves and intense discomfort with freezing temperatures as they fish in the Bering sea. Sacrificing tooth and nail to catch the seasonal delicacies to later sell and trade on land. Witness the dangers these fisher men face as they battle against the sea, and experience how caution is a crucial part of staying alive.

Witness the dangers these fisher men face as they battle against the sea, and experience how caution is a crucial part of staying alive.

programme.title: Kõige ohtlikum saak
programme.desc: A documentary chronicling real life the adventures of one of the most deadliest professions in the world. Follow Alaskan crab fishermen as they face 40-foot waves and intense discomfort with freezing temperatures as they fish in the Bering sea. Sacrificing tooth and nail to catch the seasonal delicacies to later sell and trade on land. Witness the dangers these fisher men face as they battle against the sea, and experience how caution is a crucial part of staying alive.

programme.title: Paastemehed
programme.desc: Mike Whiteside and Robert Kulp are the hosts of Salvage Dawgs show that is about saving beautiful old things from buildings planned to be torn down. They and their talented crew teach the viewers how to repurpose old stuff into something new and useful instead of throwing it away. So if you are remodeling your home think twice before you get rid of anything. Get creative, have some fun and learn tips and tricks to help you build your skills. Learn how to transform old chairs into a functional bench, how to repurpose an old paneled door into a shelf and enjoy fantastic vintage pieces from the past.

programme.title: Pagasi lahingud
programme.desc: Featuring professional buyers including antique dealers, a production designer and an eCommerce expert, these expert buyers travel around the world to lost baggage auctions, estate auctions and police auctions to find the hidden treasure and items left behind or siezed by customs in order to make the greatest profit. This American docu-reality series created by The Travel Channel in 2012. Finding contents in baggage such as a bronze sculpture, jewellery including 18 karat gold and a legendary belt, these professionals prove why they have a name for themselves in their industry, finding hidden gems in hidden places.

programme.title: Automuujad
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. The hosts are real masters of their trade, it seems they can bring life even to a piece of metal. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Kuidas nad seda teevad?
programme.desc: Avasta, kuidas tehakse asju, millest koosneb meie tanapaevane maailm.

programme.title: Kuidas see tehtud on?
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how things that surround us every day are produced? Find out about the whole process from the beginning to the end in a documentary television series How Its Made. The series demonstrates how various items like clothing and accessories, food, industrial products, cars, musical instruments and many more are manufactured. Who would have thought how exciting it would be to watch a cupcake, formula 1 race car or gummy vitamins being made?

programme.title: Automuujad
programme.desc: Buy, repair and restore and then resell a classic car in order to make profit- this is what Wheeler Dealers is about. The budget is limited, though you can see some exclusive and rare cars. Mike Brewer, a British dealer chooses the car carefully and hands it over to the mechanic, first Edd China, later Ant Anstead to be fixed and upgraded. It does not matter if you are a life-long car enthusiast or do not even have a driving license you will admire the results of hard work from the beginning to the end of the long uneasy restoring process.

programme.title: Marooned with Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Adrenaline-filled documentary series in which Ed Stafford, British explorer and adventurer, travels to remote destinations and some of the worlds toughest environments to see if he can survive there on his own, without even essential equipment such as clothes, food, and tools. He can only take his camera, an emergency satellite phone and an emergency medical kit. Staffords goal is to see if he can not only survive, but prosper under these extreme conditions, pushing his body and mind to the limit.

programme.title: Alaska metsarahvas
programme.desc: Alaskan Bush People is an American docudrama-style reality TV series revolving around the Brown family, members of which are trying to survive in the wilderness, far away from the society. Take a journey deep into Alaskas bush, where naturalist and adventurer Billy Brown, along with his wife, Ami, and their seven children, choose to live life on their own terms, connected to wild nature and bonded to each other.

programme.title: Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Join English daredevil and adventurer Ed Stafford as he pits himself against some of the most experienced and skilful explorers on the planet in challenges to survive under extreme conditions. This action-packed show provides plenty of heart-stopping drama and excitement as Ed tries to be the First Man Out. Follow Ed as he goes toe-to-toe with an ultra-fit ex-marine as they race across Borneos mangrove swamps while trying to avoid encountering any of the swamps crocodiles; or watch as Ed takes on an ex-special forces soldier from South Korea as they navigate the wilderness home of the wolf in Kazakhstan; or join Ed as he battles with Royal Air Force survival instructor John Hudson as they cross the Himalayas while dealing with monsoon rains and lethal bears.

programme.title: Elukoha paastmine
programme.desc: This reality TV show follows Marty Raney and his two children, Matt Raney and Misty Bilodeau, who are successful homesteaders from the state of Alaska and have the skills needed to fish, hunt, raise livestock, and otherwise survive in an untamed landscape. Struggling homesteaders across the country call these experts to help them save their homesteads and become self-sufficient while they teach them the necessary skills to survive the wilderness.

programme.title: Aardekutid
programme.desc: Meet modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard. With demanding customers, high turnover, and one of the biggest decorative salvage yards in the UK, Drew is constantly on the road, crisscrossing the country in search of derelict gems and forgotten remnants. Drew loves the thrill of the hunt and while he gets his hands dirty in the countrys architectural backwaters, his team of restorers is back at the shop giving old and rare finds a new lease on life!

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.sub-title: Alfa Romeo Spider and Renault GTA
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland travel across the United Kingdom to uncover classic cars to buy, restore and sell on for a profit. The pair scour garages, barns and facilities to discover collectible cars which include the likes of the Morris Minor Traveller, Jaguar XJS, Rover P6 and a BMW 635 CSI among many others. The combination of Drews expertise of negotiation and deal-making and Pauls extensive mechanical knowledge makes them a formidable team ready to tackle anything challenging that comes their way.

programme.title: Border Control
programme.desc: Going through customs can be a stressful experience for most people, even more so if youre attempting to smuggle drugs or weapons into the country. Follow the efforts of the Security and Customs Services at the border of Spain, as they work hard to keep their country safe from criminals. Whether its drugs, weapons or even terrorism, theres a lot of things security have to consider in order to make sure all threats are handled properly. These security forces are always hot on the trail of suspicious activity, in the air, on land or away at sea.

programme.title: Kullapalavik
programme.desc: Gold Rush is a reality television series that follows the placer gold mining efforts of various family-run mining companies in boundless north of America. The series focuses on the work process in the conditions of permafrost and working relations between the participants. The show has 10 seasons altogether. In some episodes participants start the adventure and travel to Alaska to search for gold because of financial issues. They do not have any previous experience and have to learn on the job. Then there appears several gold mining teams that compete with each other. In some episodes the teams move to South America. Admire the courage and determination of the team members in their unstoppable desire to become rich.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Did you know that Australia accounts for over 95% of the worlds supply of opal? Well, these miners do, and in this documentary series we follow groups of brave and persevering souls as they scour the land in search of the precious and highly valuable gemstone. With many of the mines located in the desolately deserted Outback, the crews must face some of Australias most treacherous landscapes if they are to hit the jackpot. The six crews have to weigh up the consequences in these old and hazardous mines, often risking their lives in search of opal wealth, not to mention preventing opportunistic thieves from snatching their hauls.

programme.title: Hoffman Family Gold
programme.desc: A spin-off of Gold Rush, that follows Todd Hoffman, his father Jack, and his son Hunter, as they embark on an exciting new adventure, travelling to Alaska in an attempt to find gold. If they want a big payout and to turn around a distressed mine, the guys and their crew - Jim Thurber, foreman Andy Spinks, and bush mechanic Randy Hubler, will have to overcome many obstacles, such as Alaskas unforgiving weather, other crews, and malfunctioning equipment.

programme.title: Elukoha paastmine

programme.title: Sofia see esimene
programme.desc: Sofia, is a little girl with a commoners background until her mom marries the King and suddenly she is royalty. With the help of the three fairies in charge of the Royal Training Academy, Sofia learns that looking like a princess isnt all that hard but behaving like one must come from the heart.

programme.title: Sofia see esimene
programme.desc: Sofia, is a little girl with a commoners background until her mom marries the King and suddenly she is royalty. With the help of the three fairies in charge of the Royal Training Academy, Sofia learns that looking like a princess isnt all that hard but behaving like one must come from the heart.

programme.title: The Lion Guard
programme.desc: The Lion Guard helps Timon and Pumbaa have a real Christmas.

programme.title: Jazz à Vienne
programme.desc: A number of spellbinding performances from Jazz à Vienne, a well-known Jazz Festival that takes place annually, in France. Every evening there are concerts in the ancient Roman theater of Vienne. Among the performers there have been musicians such as Miles Davis, Stan Getz, Michel Petrucciani, Ella Fitzgerald, and many more. In addition to the main concerts there are smaller ones on other stages in the city, and in pubs and musical moves.

programme.title: Portrait of Roy Ayers
programme.desc: "The legend of the groove" is a series of documentaries devoted to the musicians who were most influential on contemporary hip hop, soul, rhythm n blues, and on the course of history. Between the late 1950s and now, these musicians radically changed music. Although sometimes hardly in the public eye, they have all been major sources of inspiration for todays major artists: Prince, Erykah Badu, Janis Joplin and Jimi Hendrix.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves/Whats new/Moonlight in Vermont
programme.desc: Explore the music of one of the most influential and innovative saxophonists in jazz history: John Coltrane! Immerse yourself in this collection of remarkable performances from the early 1960s that showcase Coltranes unparalleled artistry and unique sound during a transformative period in the artists career. Recorded in various European cities, Coltrane is seen playing the songs "Autumn Leaves", "Hackensack", "My Favorite Things", "I Want To Talk About You", "Vigil", and "Naima". Tune in and experience why the music of John Coltrane has touched the lives of so many!

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: Runtown - La Machine de Moulin Rouge
programme.desc: Enjoy Runtowns first concert in Paris, where the Nigerian superstar brings many guests to his show. One of the most talented Nigerian afrobeat scenes will make you rediscover his greatest hits. Nigeria is a very creative country when it comes to the music scene. Runtown is no exception. His first single, "Party Like Its 1980," paved the way for "Gallardo," which caught the entire international scenes attention. Runtowns inspiration comes from the greats, from Salif Keita and Fela Kuti to Otis Redding and Bob Marley. An exceptional event not to be missed.

programme.title: BIRD - The Nest
programme.desc: Five promising musicians get together in Rotterdam jazz club BIRDs artists-in-residence project "The Nest". Over the course of seven sessions, these talents exchange ideas, work on their projects, and play music together. Following this period, during which record producer Jameszoo and music manager Jochem Tromp offer their coaching experience, BIRD and North Sea Jazz Festivals fringe festival DownTown organize a tryout performance. In this short documentary, the artists share their impressions from the project. They introduce themselves, reveal why they joined The Nest and formulate what they hope to learn from the experience. Naturally, we get a glimpse of the songs they wrote during the sessions, as performed during the tryout show. Featuring Lisette Ma Neza (slam poet), Peter Somuah (trumpet), Michelle Samba (drums), Huy Le (bass), and Brenn Luiten (piano).

programme.title: Kurhaus Scheveningen
programme.desc: The Dutch world-class jazz pianist Peter Beets has shared the stage with jazz greats like Chick Corea, Wynton Marsalis, "Toots" Thielemans, Elvin Jones, George Coleman, Johnny Griffin, Benny Golson and John Clayton. From birth, Beets was surrounded by music: he heard classical music from his mother, who is a music pedagogue, and he heard jazz from his father, who has a great fan of Oscar Peterson and Art Blakey. Although Beets parents originally did not associate the word "musician" with the word "career", music is definitely in the familys blood. At this concert at the Kurhaus in Scheveningen, the Netherlands, Peter Beets teams up with the world-famous guitarist Kurt Rosenwinkel. With a career spanning almost twenty-five years and including collaborating with dynamic peers like Brad Mehldau, Brian Blade, Mark Turner, Joshua Redman, Chris Potter, as well as esteemed jazz legends like Joe Henderson, Paul Motian and Gary Burton, Rosenwinkels indelible mark in music is the consummation of being steeped in the rich and deep traditions of jazz, springing off of the shoulders of such vital underpinnings to elevate his own art to new heights, evolving the language in a way no other guitarist has since his arrival. This collaboration between Beets and Rosenwinkel guarantees brilliant music.

programme.title: Belgium Sessions
programme.desc: In this DJAZZ.tv Belgium Sessions performance, which was recorded at AED Studios in Lint, Belgium, we witness Europes finest jazz musicians at work. A wide variety of international jazz musicians give a creative, up-close and inside insight into their art of playing jazz music. Young talent and established jazz musicians play to their hearts content: take for instance this unusual performance by Saxkartel. This band plays jazz and modern music with an uncommon approach: as a saxophone quartet, they perform chamber-like music without the accompaniment of a rhythm section. Their approach is similar to that of the classical string quartet, but their choice of repertoire clearly sets them apart: they play pure jazz!

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1986, renowned American saxophonist Wayne Shorter performed with his quartet at the North Sea Jazz festival in The Hague. The acclaimed musician has quite a notable career, having been a composer for Art Blakeys Jazz Messengers, a member of Miles Davis Second Great Quintet and a co-founder of the lauded jazz fusion group Weather Report.

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The series Da Pá Virada sessions presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this series is Caixa Cubo. This trio usually explores Brazils rhythmically rich landscapes, combining them with modern Brazilian jazz trends. Yet in this singular performance, Caixa Cubo teams up with vocalist Ze Leônidas, selecting special repertoire together with Dani Gurgel from Da Pá Virada Sessions and Rokas Kučinskas from Stingray DJAZZ.

programme.title: The last chieftain
programme.desc: In 2019, the vibrant city of Sofia, Bulgaria, hosted the International A to JazZ Festival. Among the featured acts was the trailblazing jazz trumpeter Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah. This genre-defying artist captivated the audience with his eclectic "stretch music"; an approach that incorporates hip-hop and reaches back through the American canon into African percussion and its rich melodic content. Trumpeter Christian Scott aTunde Adjuahs quintet, which includes drummer Corey Fonville, percussionist Weedie Braimah, pianist Lawrence Fields, and bass guitarist Max Mucha, delivered a performance that defied boundaries and expectations.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Terrasson and Belmondo
programme.sub-title: Terrasson and Belmondo: À Nous Garo
programme.desc: Every year, the Jazz en Baie festival takes place in the beautiful bay of Mont Saint-Michel Todays broadcast shows a special gathering between two grandmasters of French jazz: pianist Jacky Terrasson and trumpeter Stephane Belmondo. The two team up for an amazing concert in which jazz is combined with soul and a touch of chanson française. The Franco-American pianist Terrasson delights in travelling the world, collaboration with others and leading his own trio, quartet, or quintet. With his long-time friend, Stephane Belmondo, Terrasson has produced wonderful CDs and beautiful concerts. One then finds the trumpeter on the pianists album Gouache; on another, the pianist guests on Belmondos Ever After. At the Jazz en Baie festival, the duo plays its amazing piano and trumpet music. Highly recommended!

programme.title: The Tallberg Foundation
programme.sub-title: The Tallberg Foundation: "Jazz for the Planet"
programme.desc: On October 19, 2021, John Patitucci (bass), Marco Pignataro (sax and musical director), and Joe Lovano (sax) showcased inspirational new originals at GBHs Fraser Performance Studio in Boston, MA, accompanied by Terri Lyne Carrington (drums), Nadia Washington (vocals), Chico Pinheiro (guitar), and Anastassiya Petrova (piano). This recording, titled Tallbergs Jazz for the Planet, was made in support of the Tallberg Foundations message and aims to inspire positive climate action. Since 1981, the Tallberg Foundation has been trying to nurture new thinking, in part by looking at societal challenges through the lenses of artists.

programme.title: Paradox Live
programme.desc: Innovative contemporary jazz and improvised music, the search for modernity, mind blowing sounds, rock and pop… Indeed PARADOX Tilburg goes beyond jazz, crossing musical boundaries into the unknown soundscapes of electronic music. Indie artists, blues veterans and jazz superstars all pour their hearts and souls at the Paradox. From young, local talents to top national and international artists, PARADOX Tilburg is the most intimate jazz club in the Netherlands, with a devoted audience from all across Europe. In their TV show PARADOX LIVE you get a taste of the greatest concerts and interviews with artists from all around the world. This episode of PARADOX LIVE presents the amazing Dutch jazzband BRUUT led by saxophone player Maarten Hoogenhuis!

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Scott DuBois Quartet Live In Munich
programme.desc: Rising star of the jazz guitar Scott DuBois leads his quartet, consisting of Gebhard Ullmann (reeds), Thomas Morgan (bass), and Kresten Osgood (drums), in an intimate and atmospheric performance at Munichs Jazz Club Unterfahrt in March 2016. The groups telepathy is such that they are able to go from deathly quiet to fiercely avant-garde at the drop of a hat. For this occasion, DuBois and his group gave a full performance of his "Winter Light" album, released a few months earlier, plus his Lake Shore Suite.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: Belgium Sessions
programme.desc: In this DJAZZ Belgium Sessions performance, which was recorded at AED Studios in Lint, Belgium, we witness Europes finest jazz musicians at work. A wide variety of international jazz musicians give a creative, up-close and inside insight into their art of playing jazz music. Young talent and established jazz musicians play to their hearts content: take for instance this unusual performance by the trio Massot/Florizoone/Horbaczewski. This adventurous threesome pushes the boundaries of jazz, folk and classical music. There is a certain commonality between the instruments they play: accordion, tuba and cello share a richness of sound, as well as a broad register and a photogenic appearance. When improvising, the trio produces the weirdest and wackiest, but also most moving sounds.

programme.title: Trio Chemirani
programme.desc: The veritable tombak virtuosos of Trio Chemirani, consisting of Chemirani Senior and Juniors, enrapture the Festival de Saintes. The tombak is a Persian percussion instrument, but its rhythms are universal. The Trio Chemiranis music is accessible to all and will certainly resound with each listener. The members of the trio, Djamchid Chemirani (born in Teheran in 1942) and his two sons and pupils Keyvan and Bijan, are living in France. Their concert performances bring them all over the world, as they explore the endless potential of their Persian percussion instruments. The trio finds also inspiration in Mediterranean modal music and jazz. These three musicians, who might well be thought of as poets are in search of a common language that connects several cultures.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Baden Powell Quartet - Jazz Samba
programme.desc: Recorded in 1971 in Paris, France, Brazilian, classically trained bossa nova guitarist Baden Powell and his quartet play Pai, Lotus (written by Baden Powell), Tristeza (by Haroldo Lobo/Niltinho), Round Midnight (by Thelonious Monk), Nega do cabelo duro (by David Nasser/Rubens Soares), and Aos pes da cruz (by Ze da Zilda/Marino Pinto). Powell is joined by Ernesto Ribeiro-Gonçalves on double bass, Helio Schiavo on drums, and Alfredo Bessa on percussion.

programme.title: Jazz à Vienne
programme.desc: A number of spellbinding performances from Jazz à Vienne, a well-known Jazz Festival that takes place annually, in France. Every evening there are concerts in the ancient Roman theater of Vienne. Among the performers there have been musicians such as Miles Davis, Stan Getz, Michel Petrucciani, Ella Fitzgerald, and many more. In addition to the main concerts there are smaller ones on other stages in the city, and in pubs and musical moves.

programme.title: WOMEX 2018
programme.desc: Since 1994, World Music Expo (WOMEX) has been attracting musicians, agents, a great number of press agencies, as well as media companies from all over the world. Its main exposition event has been held in various locations throughout Europe, including Berlin, Brussels, Marseille, Stockholm, Seville, Cardiff, and Budapest. In 2018, WOMEX was held in Las Palmas, Gran Canaria. One of its showcase participants, Malagasy power trio Toko Telo, combines dazzling musicianship with sparkling compositions inspired by their shared southern Madagascar roots, featuring the soulful voice of Monika Njava and dexterously interweaving guitar wizardry from DGary and Joël Rabesolo.

programme.title: Aki Rissanen Trio at Jazzclub Unterfahrt, Munich
programme.desc: Aki Rissanens interest in jazz came after he started taking classical piano lessons. His deep interest in improvised music placed him among top jazz pianist in his home country - Finland. While composing and performing his own music, Rissanen has also collaborated with Verneri Pohjola and Dave Liebman, and today his name appears among the top European jazz musicians. Live from "Jazzclub Unterfahrt" in Munich, Germany, together with Antti Lotjonen on bass and Teppo Makynen on drums, Rissanen showcases the best of Scandinavian jazz and its DNA - the Nordic Tone.

programme.title: Tim Kliphuis and the NCO
programme.sub-title: Tim Kliphuis and the NCO: The Changing Seasons
programme.desc: The Netherlands Chamber Orchestra commissioned violinist Tim Kliphuis, internationally known for his genre-crossing approach to music, to write a new version of Antonio Vivaldis Four Seasons. Kliphuis choose to take improvisation as his starting point; at the same time, he intended to leave the best-known Vivaldi themes and chords in, as they give the piece its wonderful energy. The result is a fresh and exciting interpretation that never loses sight of the original. Each season has a different character: the freshness of spring is reflected by the use of Irish and Norwegian traditional music; the summer heat can be heard in the American jazz and funk rhythms; the autumn includes a galloping safari hunt in South-Africa and the ice-cold winter warms up with the energy of Russian gypsy music. For each movement, Kliphuis has a metropole in mind which he visited on his previous concert tours. Youre about to witness a truly genre-crossing spectacle!

programme.title: Anita Oday Live in Sweden 1963
programme.desc: Anita ODay boasts two wonderful concerts from 1963 and 1970 that present the "jazz singer supreme" in impeccable form. ODays horn-based approach to singing is in full effect throughout both shows including stand-out renditions in each show of audience favorites "Tea For Two" and "Sweet Georgia Brown" (both reprised from her triumphant appearance at the 1958 Newport Jazz Festival.) This show is a fitting testimony to one of jazz musics true originals and shows unequivocally why she is ranked in the top tier of vocalists along with Ella Fitzgerald, Sarah Vaughan, and Billie Holiday.

programme.title: DJAZZ Portrait
programme.desc: These portraits of artists, concerts and festivals provide a good picture of the jazz world. They are portraits of well-known and less known jazz artists who give us an insight into their lives amongst other things, DJAZZ asked them why they wrote that particular song, what was the first record this musician bought and what his or her most cherished musical memory is. The festival portraits are beautiful reports of the most special jazz festivals and concerts. They revive the festival with the music and experience.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: TorTube
programme.desc: Jazz fans in television land have come to the right place for their dose of first-rate world jazz: TorTube! Jazz club De Tor in Enschede is one of Europes most authentic jazz venues, with an absolutely unique ambiance. Some of the best musicians from Holland and the rest of the world find their way to De Tor to perform for an appreciative audience of jazz fans. La Waltz 2, 3 and More is an episode of TorTube that pulls you into the world of De Tor. Veteran vocalist Humphrey Campbell shares the stage with chromatic harmonica player Hermine Deurloo for a unique mix of spectacular music.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da Pá Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the artists taking part in this series is Martina Marana. Vocalist, instrumentalist, and composer Martina Marana uses the power of irony to show how women instrumentalists are misjudged. In her music, Martina breaks free of sexist labels, reclaiming her own power as musician and composer. A gifted lyricist, Marana makes uncompromising, unique music.

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da Pá Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this series is Os Capoeira. This ensemble practices the traditional Brazilian martial art from Bahia it is named after, combining elements of dance, acrobatics, and percussive music. Moreover, Os Capoeira runs a cultural center in Sao Paulo. Let yourself be inspired by Os Capoeiras unique take on Brazilian culture!

programme.title: Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: Estival Jazz Lugano is an annual open-air music festival that takes place over five days at the picturesque city of Lugano, Switzerland. Since 1979, this musical Mecca has been a must-attend event for all jazz and world music fans worldwide. On July 3, 1985, pianist and space-faring jazz icon Sun Ra and his Arkestra crash-landed at Estival Jazz Lugano. Featuring saxophonists Marshall Allen, John Gilmore and Danny Ray Thompson, clarinetist Eloe Omoe, flautist James Jackson, trombonist Tyrone Hill and a cavalcade of other costumed talents, Sun Ra puts on a truly out-of-this-world concert.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Selah Sue @ Festival Culturebox
programme.desc: Belgian singer-songwriter Selah Sue performed at La Cigale in Paris as part of the digital Culturebox Festival 2020. The singer released her million-selling debut album "Selah Sue" in March 2011, featuring her popular single "Raggamuffin" and her duet "Please" with American hip-hop artist Cee Lo Green. Months after its release, Selah was presented with a European Border Breakers Award (EBBA), for her cross-border success. At La Cigale in 2020, Selah Sue is accompanied by Joachim Saerens on keyboard and Simon Lenski on cello, opening her concert with a jazzed-up So This Is Love, a romantic ballad from Walt Disneys film Cinderella.

programme.title: Les McCann
programme.sub-title: Les McCann: Live in New Orleans
programme.desc: Autodidact Les McCann became an international jazz star he is today after the release of his album "Swiss Movement" in 1968 which was recorded with Eddie Harris. However this musician has many other sides of achievements than that one record such as; McCann effortlessly switched between styles and stood his ground in every role from bop to fusion, from vocals to electric piano and clavinet to synthesizer, his is mix of church music and swing fits perfectly in the spirit of his time although at one point within the 90s he was only able to play with a single finger due to his illness. In todays broadcast, McCann brings gospel back to the New Orleans where this set was played in 1983. McCanns vocals triumph in the soulful performance of many of his hits, including Just Like Magic. He is accompanied by his fantastic "Magic Band" consisting of saxophonist Bobby Bryant Jr., bassist Curtis Roberson Jr. and drummer Tony St. James.

programme.title: Art Blakey Live in 1965
programme.desc: Art Blakey: Live in 65 features what many consider to be one of the finest lineups in the history of jazz: Art Blakey (Drums), Bobby Timmons (Piano), Jymie Merritt (Bass), Benny Golson (Sax), and the legendary trumpet player, Lee Morgan. Lost for nearly 50 years, this historic 55-minute concert, filmed in Belgium in 1958 is the only known visual document of this influential band who were together for only six months.

programme.title: Mont Saint-Michel
programme.sub-title: Mont Saint-Michel: Steve Grossman and Peter King
programme.desc: Every year, the Jazz en Baie festival takes place in the beautiful bay of Mont Saint-Michel. Todays broadcast shows a special gathering between saxophone heavyweights Peter King and Steve Grossman. These experienced musicians trip to the bay amounts to much more than a social call. The quintet, which is rounded out by bass player Duylinh NGuyen, drummer Stephane Huchard and pianist Alain Jean-Marie, delivers an amazing show. Although the two saxophonists have an average age of 70, these jazz titans will convince you youre watching young musicians on stage - albeit with 70 years of experience.

programme.title: Slash
programme.sub-title: Slash: Live at The Sydney Entertainment Centre
programme.desc: When Daryl Hall and John Oates took to the stage at Sydneys Entertainment Centre as the iconic bass line of "Maneater" began to play, the fans knew they were in for a treat. This duo may have been opening concerts with that irresistibly smooth number for years, but it never seems to lose its magic, and the crowd - an eclectic mix of teens and baby boomers alike - lapped it up. Daryl Hall and John Oates wisely reunited a few years ago after a string of solo projects, and although Oates no longer sports his signature tache, they put on the kind of show that makes it hard to believe they even considered going their separate ways. Earworms like I Cant Go For That, "Out Of Touch" and "Kiss On My List" were surefire reminders that these guys are absolute hit machines, and their catchy synth-soul classics probably deserve to permeate the airwaves as much today as they did decades ago. These Philly crooners still have it in bucket-loads, so this show should have everyone from diehard Daryl Hall and John Oates fans to kids of the 80s groovin along in no time.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Louis Armstrong
programme.desc: Following a highly successful small-group jazz concert at New York Town Hall on May 17, 1947, Armstrongs manager Joe Glaser dissolved the Armstrong big band on August 13, 1947 and established a six-piece small group. This group was called the All Stars, and in 1964 Louis Armstrong recorded his biggest-selling record, Hello, Dolly! He made assorted television appearances, especially in the 1950s and 1960s - the recorded film was a TV Show in Australia when Armstrong was at the peak of his career. Armstrong kept up his busy tour schedule until a few years before his death in 1971. He also toured Africa, Europe, and Asia under sponsorship of the US State Department with great success, earning the nickname Ambassador Satch.

programme.title: Chamber Music
programme.desc: Hailing from a long tradition of Malian kora players, Ballake Sissoko has worked with renowned musicians such as Toumani Diabate and Taj Mahal. He met the French born Vincent Segal by chance, and the two began jamming together, uncertain of what kind of music might result. As a former member of the French National Orchestra, Segals Western classical training does not prevent him from exploring a wide variety of extended techniques, rendering his cello a flexible partner to Sissokos kora. A childhood spent in the Pigalle district of Paris surrounded by immigrant communities exposed Segal to African music from an early age. As such, he possesses a natural sensitivity to Sissokos West-African style. The concert shows a brilliant interplay between the two musicians and combines the several worlds of jazz, Malian and classical music.

programme.title: Blicher Hemmer Gadd - A Music documentary
programme.desc: Award-winning saxophonist Michael Blicher, Hammond wizard Dan Hemmer and legendary drummer Steve Gadd joined forces in 2014 to celebrate their shared love for Hammond-organ soul jazz. The band, which tours extensively throughout the world, has released several albums. Their third album, which was released in November 2019, features U.K. vocalist Paul Carrack on the soulful ballad The First One To Know.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. American singer and pianist Fats Domino gave an unforgettable performance at the North Sea Jazz Festival of 1980. Domino was one of the pioneers of rock and roll music, selling more than 65 million records and having 11 top hits between 1955 and 1960.

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da Pá Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this series is Os Capoeira. This ensemble practices the traditional Brazilian martial art from Bahia it is named after, combining elements of dance, acrobatics, and percussive music. Moreover, Os Capoeira runs a cultural center in Sao Paulo. Let yourself be inspired by Os Capoeiras unique take on Brazilian culture!

programme.title: Ryan Porter and The West Coast Get Down - BIRD
programme.desc: Los Angeles-born saxophonist Kamasi Washington and trombonist Ryan Porter co-founded West Coast Get Down - a musical collective fusing jazz and funk with hip-hop. It is partly because of this collective that jazz saw a resurgence in Los Angeles, subtly eclipsing the long-established jazz mecca of the world, New York City. The two musicians join forces and take the vibes of Los Angeles to jazz club BIRD in Rotterdam, the Netherlands.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Estival Jazz Lugano
programme.desc: Since 1977, Estival is a summer jazz festival in Switzerland, Lugano. Estival offers a thrilling and particularly surprising line-up that explores the rich world of contemporary music whilst promoting the understanding of different cultures, tolerance, and co-existence. The composer, trumpeter and bugle player Franco Ambrosetti performs with his quintet in his native Lugano as part of the Estival.

programme.title: Aleph - Radio at the Symphony
programme.desc: Lebanese pianist Fady Abi Saad, internationally known as Aleph, traveled to the Czech Republic to complete his project "Radio at the Symphony". There he went into Smecky Studios together with the Prague Philharmonic Orchestra. In this project the musical influences from his homeland and jazz are never far away, with Aleph expanding his sound palette even further through the beautiful orchestral arrangements.

programme.title: Jazz Greats
programme.desc: American keyboard player and bandleader Herbie Hancock (1940) achieved success as an incisive, harmonically provocative jazz pianist in the 1960s, then went on to gain wide popularity as a leader of electric jazz-rock groups. One of these, Hancocks band The Headhunters, ushered in a new era of jazz that appealed to a far wider audience, making jazz listeners out of rhythm and blues fans, and vice versa. In 1974, The Headhunters appeared on German television, playing Palm Grease, Sly, Butterfly, Spank-A-Lee, and Chameleon. Hancock (keys) is joined by Bennie Maupin (saxophones), Paul Jackson (electric bass), Mike Clark (drums) and Bill Summer (percussion).

programme.title: Belgium Sessions
programme.sub-title: Belgium Sessions: Cavaliere and Mohy Duo
programme.desc: In this DJAZZ Belgium Sessions performance, which was recorded at AED Studios in Lint, Belgium, we witness Europes finest jazz musicians at work. A wide variety of international jazz musicians give a creative, up-close and inside insight into their art of playing jazz music. Young talent and established jazz musicians play to their hearts content: take for instance this performance by violinist Alexandre Cavaliere and pianist Pascal Mohy. This recording marks the first time that these talented, rising jazz stars share the same stage. They tackle material made famous by, among others, jazz legend Miles Davis.

programme.title: Casper the Funky Ghost
programme.sub-title: Casper the Funky Ghost: Bootsy Collins à Vienne
programme.desc: Bootsy Collins, famed for playing with George Clinton and his very own Rubber Band, is used to playing syncopated, hard and relentlessly rhythmic music. With this unique style Bootsy was a major influence on the development of funk. Now in his 60s, the bassist seems animated by a new energy that reflects his new work on the album Tha Funk Capitol of the World. With this album, Bootsy Collins pays tribute to the artists with whom he worked during his frantic career: from James Brown and Parliament-Funkadelic to Fatboy Slim. During this concert, recorded at the festival Jazz à Vienne, Bootsy maintains that same energy, giving a spectacular show.

programme.title: Betty Carter/Jazzmeia Horn, Please Do Something
programme.desc: Vocalist Jazzmeia Horns 2019 Malta Jazz Festival appearance was a celebration of jazzs future, infused with the soul of its past. Featuring Keith Brown (piano), Rashaan Carter (bass), Irwin Hall (flute and saxophone), and Anwar Marshall (drums), the young singers performance was a reminder of jazzs enduring power to speak to the heart. Situated at the Valletta waterfront outside Our Lady of Liesse Church, Horns concert was a truly spellbinding experience.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: The Morgenland Festival
programme.desc: Since 2005, the Morgenland Festival of Osnabrueck has dedicated itself to the fascinating music culture of the Near and Middle East. From traditional and classical music to avant-garde, jazz, and rock, the festival program also features art, such as visual arts, dance, and theatre of interdisciplinary projects. "The Art of Duo" presents an unprecedented duo featuring pianist Salman Gambarov and sheng player, a Chinese mouth-organ, Wu Wei.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da Pá Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this series is the ensemble Samba das Flores, which dedicates itself to exploring the worlds different rhythms, thus keeping the Brazilian heritage alive. The individual voices of the ensemble members color Samba das Floress unique sound. Let Brazilian culture and global rhythms inspire you during this Samba das Flores performance!

programme.title: Da Pá Virada Sessions
programme.desc: The Da Pá Virada Sessions series presents the best musicians of contemporary Brazilian jazz, and beyond. Filmed in Sao Paulo, each session offers a unique experience by giving a fresh look into Brazils music scene. The artists for each session are selected in consultation with Stingray DJAZZs music editor. One of the bands taking part in this series is Bloco do Ó, a traditional street band associated with the Brazilian carnival. A "bloco" is a group of people who drive through the streets in trucks, playing music and providing fun to anyone who will listen. Immerse yourself in Bloco de Ós world of cheerful melodies and spectacular costumes!

programme.title: On the Road With Duke Ellington
programme.sub-title: On the Road With Duke Ellington: I
programme.desc: In May 2014, the Conservatory of Amsterdam hosted a unique conference about one of the greatest jazz composers of the 20th century: Duke Ellington. Musicologists and musicians with a special bond with Ellington and his music spoke about his life and music. Among them were David Schiff, author of The Ellington Century, and Harvey Cohen, author of Duke Ellingtons America. Moreover, concerts were played by jazz pianist Matt Cooper, the Calefax Reed Quintet, and the Concert Big Band of the Conservatory of Amsterdam conducted by David Berger. The winner of the Boy Edgar Prize 2013, viola player Oene van Geel, performed his All Ellington Project.

programme.title: DJAZZ Clips
programme.desc: An extraordinary collection of clips in all jazz genres from the most beautiful concerts and the most special festivals, performed by the finest jazz musicians.

programme.title: WOMEX 2018
programme.desc: Since 1994, World Music Expo (WOMEX) has been attracting musicians, agents, a great number of press agencies, as well as media companies from all over the world. Its main exposition event has been held in various locations throughout Europe, including Berlin, Brussels, Marseille, Stockholm, Seville, Cardiff, and Budapest. The 2018 edition of WOMEX was held in Las Palmas, Gran Canaria. One of its showcase participants, Mario Batkovic, aims to explore the sonic possibilities of the accordion, without effects or loops, rather through a mutualist symbiotic relationship between man and instrument. Challenging, hypnotic, and grandiose, Batkovics single-handed symphonic vision is certainly unique.

programme.title: WOMEX 2018
programme.desc: Since 1994, World Music Expo (WOMEX) has been attracting musicians, agents, a great number of press agencies, as well as media companies from all over the world. Its main exposition event has been held in various locations throughout Europe, including Berlin, Brussels, Marseille, Stockholm, Seville, Cardiff, and Budapest. In 2018, WOMEX was held in Las Palmas, Gran Canaria. One of its showcase participants, Nelida Karr, sings and plays guitar, piano, cello and percussion. She writes songs suffused with the many influences she assimilated growing up in Malabo in Africas only Spanish-speaking country, Equatorial Guinea. The result is an eclectic mix that she nevertheless incorporates into a sound all her own.

programme.title: Festival international de jazz Adolphe Sax
programme.desc: On June 4, 1962, the first Festival International de Jazz "Adolphe Sax" took place in the Belgian town of Dinant, where Adolphe Sax, the inventor of the saxophone, was born in 1814. Not surprisingly, most artists on the program are saxophonists. A Belgian quartet, consisting of tenor saxophonist Jacques Bailly, guitarist Willy Donni, drummer Bruno Castellucci, and bassist Jose Bedeur, opens the festival. The second highlight of the festival is a trio of Belgian pianist François Boland, who appeared with American bassist Jimmy Woode and Belgian drummer Freddy Rottier. They are joined by four international guest saxophonists: German tenorist Klaus Doldinger, Belgian altoist Jacques Pelzer, British altoist Derek Humble, and Austrian saxophonist Karl Drewo. Following individual solo features and a joint encore, a true saxophone legend appears on stage: veteran American tenorist Coleman Hawkins. Accompanied by his compatriots Jimmy Woode (bass) and "Kansas" Fields (drums) and French pianist George Arvanitas, Coleman Hawkins plays an hour-long concert that includes "Disorder At The Border", "Autumn Leaves", "Lover Come Back To Me", "Moonlight In Vermont", "All The Things You Are" and "Ow!". This concert is the perfect conclusion of the first jazz festival in honor of Adolphe Sax.

programme.title: Paradox Live
programme.desc: Innovative contemporary jazz and improvised music, the search for modernity, mind blowing sounds, rock and pop… Indeed PARADOX Tilburg goes beyond jazz, crossing musical boundaries into the unknown soundscapes of electronic music. Indie artists, blues veterans and jazz superstars all pour their hearts and souls at the Paradox. From young, local talents to top national and international artists, PARADOX Tilburg is the most intimate jazz club in the Netherlands, with a devoted audience from all across Europe. In their TV show PARADOX LIVE you get a taste of the greatest concerts and interviews with artists from all around the world. This episode of PARADOX LIVE presents the amazing Dutch saxophone player Rolf Delfos.

programme.title: Lionel Hampton Big Band - Kurhaus Scheveningen
programme.desc: The Kurhaus in Scheveningen is a grand hotel in the Netherlands renowned for attracting both royal and musical nobility. Doubling as a concert hall, it has been host to several heavy hitters, such as the Rolling Stones and Ike and Tina Turner. On August 2, 1983, American vibraphonist Lionel Hampton performed at the Kurhaus in Scheveningen. Accompanied by his big band, which included talents such as saxophonist Arnett Cobb, the "King of Vibes" gave an invigorating performance with both mallets and voice.

programme.title: North Sea Jazz Classics
programme.desc: The North Sea Jazz Festival is the largest indoor music festival in the world, known globally as the event where the past, present and future of jazz are featured within three days. Next to a firm base of jazz as the festivals staple music genre, many others, such as blues, soul, funk, or hip hop, pass by. In 1989, legendary jazz pianist Ahmad Jamal brought his trio to the North Sea Jazz Festival. Accompanied by James Cammack on bass and David Bowler on drums, Jamal showcased his excellence.

programme.title: Seine Sessions
programme.desc: The term "jam-session" was coined in the 1920s when black and white musicians gathered in smoke-filled bars after their respective concerts to enjoy the kind of jazz they could not play in traditional sets. Bing Crosby was a regular at these sessions, and had fun marking the first and third beats of musical phrases by clapping hands, which the musicians call "jammin the beat". Today, the Seine Sessions revive the happy years of "jam sessions", while the cream of jazz, blues, gipsy and funk Parisian scenes occurs on the boards of the legendary restaurant and jazz club Le Reservoir. Titled "Legendary Jazz", this episode hosted by Eddy King features unique performances by artists playing together for the first time, and interviews with Steve McCraven, Oona Guino, Rodolphe Lauretta, and many others.

programme.title: The Morgenland Festival
programme.sub-title: The Morgenland Festival: I Will Not Be Sad
programme.desc: Since 2005, the Morgenland Festival, held in Osnabrueck, has dedicated itself to the fascinating music culture of the Near and Middle East. From traditional and classical music to avant-garde, jazz, and rock, the festival program also features art, such as visual arts, dance, and theatre of interdisciplinary projects. Jivan Gasparyan Jr has always been inspired by the folk melodies of his native Armenia. His grandfather, also a musician, taught him the art of duduk, an instrument of Armenian origin.

programme.title: Tapmine
programme.desc: Sarah ja Holder on sunnitud põgenema; Stan ja Richmond seisavad silmitsi elumuutvate otsustega.

programme.title: Chicago politseijaoskond
programme.desc: Burgessi õde langeb seksuaalse runnaku ohvriks, kui teda julgustatakse veetma oo koos sõpradega.

programme.title: Monk
programme.desc: Kui tuntud anonuumne uljaspea Lendav Frisco oma uusima triki kaigus vigastada saab, selgub, et tegu on Monki kauaaegse verivaenlase Harold Krenshawga. Monk ei suuda selle teadmisega leppida ning ta asub intsidenti uurima lootuses, et Harold kõigest asendas õiget Friscot.

programme.title: Hudson ja Rex
programme.desc: Kui kohalik vaalavaatluslaev naaseb salaparaselt sadamasse ilma reisijateta, peavad Charlie ja Rex jooksma võidu ajaga, et leida kadunud turistid.

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Õhk on paks Louis ja Leopoldi labiraakimistest Hispaania ule. Bastillei vangla ulem puuab Philippei veenda oma nutulauluga. Sophie ullatab Marchali.

programme.title: Alasti ahvatlus
programme.desc: Soome versioon omanaolisest kohtingusaatest, kus valik tehakse aeglaselt paljastuvate alasti kehade põhjal.

programme.title: Alasti ahvatlus
programme.desc: Soome versioon omanaolisest kohtingusaatest, kus valik tehakse aeglaselt paljastuvate alasti kehade põhjal.

programme.title: Armastuse saar
programme.desc: Armastusesaar hõlmab gruppi võitslejaid, keda nimetatakse saarlasteks. Nad elavad valismaailmast eraldatuna Mallorca villas ja on pideva videovalve all. Villas ellujaamiseks peavad saarlased olema paaris mõne teise saarlasega ning sooritama erinevaid valjakutseid. Võitnud paar saab endale 56 000 eurot.

programme.title: Saatmata kirjade lood
programme.desc: Postitootajad asuvad teele vana matkaautoga, et leida roovitud poiss. 1980ndatest parit fotoaparaadist leitud ebatavalised fotod viivad tiimi seikluslikule teekonnale labi Colorado.

programme.title: Majajahtijad
programme.desc: Kulmalaine seiskab Chicagos suure remondi, mille kaigus peaks valja vahetatama terve kook ja peamine vannituba.

programme.title: Pilvede all
programme.desc: Mari ei tea, kuidas Valteriga tekkinud ebamugavast olukorrast valja tulla. Siiri uritab teha kõik, et ema tagasi koju sõidaks. Albert keeldub Sirjet aitamast. Kiku puuab Liisale toeks olla. Madis puuab Kertut veenda abieluettepanekut vastu võtma.

programme.title: Vana silla saladus
programme.desc: Severo on meeleheitel. Julieta valdib lahedust Prudencioga. Alfonso ja Emilia viivad Juanita Nicolási juurde.

programme.title: Esmakohtingud
programme.desc: Juustuvalmistaja Archie loodab leida tõelise armastuse Emmas, kellel on varrukast võtta hulgaliselt juustunalju. Tatoveerimisstuudio juhataja ja retrofann Donna laheb kohtama 1950. aastate fanni Anthonyga. Kas ettevõtja Francesca leiab tõelise armastuse ameeriklasest arijuhiga? Stjuuardess Demi kardab, et ta peletab mehi eemale, kuid Arron võtab sihiks vastupidise tõestamise.

programme.title: Kodus ja võõrsil
programme.desc: Malit vaevab suutunne. Irene korraldab õhtusoogi, mis ei lõpe hasti. John on nõutu.

programme.title: Igavene armastus
programme.desc: Kaes on Kemali ja Nihani pulmapaev. Zeynep kuuleb, et Emiril on midagi plaanis ja ta hoiatab Kemali. Ayhan valvab pulmapaika, kuid Emir võtab Kemali kinni Huseini habemeajamistoolis. Kemal viiakse haigla rõhukambrisse surema. Nihan on paanikas. Zehri ja Zeynep kihutavad Kemali paastma. Toimub pulmatseremoonia.

programme.title: Toidu ABC
programme.desc: Sarja "Toidu ABC" avaosas laheb Jimmy Pariisi baguetteide saladust avastama; Matt kohtub Itaalias maailma enim poputatud kariloomadega, uurides samas, miks on puhvlipiima Mozzarella lehmapiima omast nii palju kallim ning Briony teeb ullatava avastuse selle kohta, kuidas hernetambi jaoks herneid tambitakse.

programme.title: Toidu ABC
programme.sub-title: Kreeka pahklid, hapud maiused, hagusad õlled
programme.desc: "Toidu ABC" leiab vastused ka kõige põletavamatele kusimustele toidu kohta meie laual. Selles osas otsib Helen Californias taiuslikult puhastatud Kreeka pahklite saladust; Matt ajab huuled prunti, et selgitada valja, mis teeb hapud maiused hapuks: ning Andi selgitab valja, mis teeb supermarketitesse ilmunud trendikad hagusad õlled hagusaks.

programme.title: Magidoktor
programme.desc: Doktor Gruber avastab ulemleitnant Mia Lohmannil maksakasvaja. Muretsev Mia võtab uhendust oma poja isaga, kellega ta pole ammu suhelnud ja kes ei tea, et tal on poeg. Kuidas mees uudisele reageerib? Franziska ema esitab Martinile tõsise ultimaatumi, mis mõjutab oluliselt ka Hansu ja Anne projekte. Lisaks ootab Martinit haiglas karm ullatus.

programme.title: Magidoktor
programme.desc: Doktor Gruber avastab ulemleitnant Mia Lohmannil maksakasvaja. Muretsev Mia võtab uhendust oma poja isaga, kellega ta pole ammu suhelnud ja kes ei tea, et tal on poeg. Kuidas mees uudisele reageerib? Franziska ema esitab Martinile tõsise ultimaatumi, mis mõjutab oluliselt ka Hansu ja Anne projekte. Lisaks ootab Martinit haiglas karm ullatus.

programme.title: Armastus pasta vastu
programme.desc: Ariel Moss naeb kohalikus soogikohas meest, keda ta peab oma unistuste meheks. Puudes teda taas kohata, kohtub ta nagusa restoranipidaja Danieliga, kes aitab tal mõista, et võib-olla kaib tee tema sudamesse hoopis kõhu kaudu.

programme.title: Saladused
programme.desc: Lõbus pulmatrall! 20-aastane Maret on oma poiss-sõbrast Margusest rasedaks jaanud ja nõukogude moraali seisukohast ning vanatadi Alviine survel peavad tulevased lapsevanemad ikka enne lapse sundi ka abiellu astuma. Ja nii algavad uheaegselt ettevalmistused nii lapse sunniks kui pulmapeo korraldamiseks, siis võtab aga kogu tegevus ootamatu poorde.

programme.title: Õhtu!
programme.desc: Meelelahutuslik ja manguline vestlussaade "Õhtu!" on seltsiks argiõhtutel. Saatejuhid Robert Rool ja Juri Butšakov ullatavad uute teemade, kulaliste ja mangudega ning muudavad toopaeva õhtud alati positiivseks ja heatujuliseks.

programme.title: Esmakohtingud
programme.desc: Üliõpilane Afope otsib meest, kes oleks emotsionaalselt sama vaba kui ta ise. Ärinduses tootav Luke puuab ule saada oma pahapoisi renomeest ning laheb kohtama perfektsionistist Adamiga. Talunik Chris toob kontoriassistent Dianele kingiks peete. Kehalise kasvatuse õpetaja Jude loodab leida armastuse varbaja Laureniga, kuid õnnetu juhus võib rikkuda nende sideme.

programme.title: Kodus ja võõrsil
programme.desc: Perril on oma erilisel paeval raskusi. Irene põletab sildu. John puuab oma parimat sõpra paasta.

programme.title: Pulmahooaeg
programme.desc: Ajakirjanikuna leiba teeniv Trish peab olema pruutneitsi oma kolme hea sõbranna pulmas, mis toimuvad kõik uksteise jarel. Kuna tal pole kaaslast, palub ta fotograaf Ryani abi, kes on ta parima sõbranna vend.

programme.title: Minu emps on kõvem kokk kui sinu ema
programme.desc: Vanemad juhendavad ja lapsed kokkavad. Žurii valib valja maitsvama roa. Parem paar võidab auhinnaraha ja paaseb jargmisesse saatesse. Seto kasitoo edendaja ning valitsev sõira ja leiva meister Ingrit ja tutar Kati astuvad tana koogis vastamisi suurfarmis tootava Katlini ja tema sulgpalli armastava tutre Loretaga.

programme.title: Õhtusook kahele
programme.desc: Bridgendis elav Alex peab viie õhtusoogi valjanagemise põhjal valja valima kolm naist, kellega ka koos õhtust suua. Kas keegi neist aga vaarib ka teisele kohtingule minemist?

programme.title: Alasti ahvatlus
programme.desc: Soome versioon omanaolisest kohtingusaatest, kus valik tehakse aeglaselt paljastuvate alasti kehade põhjal.

programme.title: Valelikud võrgutajad
programme.desc: Spenceri vanemad kaaluvad tudruku psuhholoogi jutule viimist. Ashley viskab Calebi majast valja ning Hanna ja Caleb veedavad oo koos. Üksteisele pakuvad seltsi nii Emily ja Paige kui ka Spencer ja Toby. Politsei leiab uue kahtlusaluse.

programme.title: Armastuse saar
programme.desc: Saareelanikud naudivad suve nagu ei kunagi varem, ent tanasel õhtul on veel palju ullatusi varuks ja võistlus kaib. Aaronil on tuli Dannyga parast seda, kui too uritab Lucindat tema ees parast paaride vahetust suudelda.

programme.title: Poissmees paradiisis
programme.desc: Kuurort on avatud ning varasemad publiku lemmikud unistuste poissmehed ja vallalised kaunitarid on valmis leidma endale kaaslase, kolides selleks Mehhiko troopilisse oaasi.

programme.title: Toidu ABC
programme.desc: Purustame toiduainete kohta keerlevaid muute ja laseme teaduslikel argumentidel kõnelda.

programme.title: Majajahtijad
programme.desc: California pere loodab leida kodu, kus on suur tagahoov ja varskenduskuuri labinud vannituba. Kuid selgub, et see pole sugugi lihtne, sest pereisa vihkab ummargusi disainielemente ja pereema põlgab keset dušipõrandat paiknevaid aravoolutorusid.

programme.title: Pilvede all
programme.desc: Mari puuab Valteriga juhtunut heastada. Eriku ootamatu kulaskaik ajab Kertu segadusse. Madise kaitumine tekitab kusimusi. Andres puuab soojendada suhteid Siiri ja Joosu vahel. Indrek tunnistab ules, millega ta Mari selja taga hakkama on saanud.

programme.title: Vana silla saladus
programme.desc: Nicolás paistab saatusega leppinud. Prudencio tabab Julieta Saúliga raakimas. Don Anselmo kulastab Irenet.

programme.title: Esmakohtingud
programme.desc: Üliõpilane Afope otsib meest, kes oleks emotsionaalselt sama vaba kui ta ise. Ärinduses tootav Luke puuab ule saada oma pahapoisi renomeest ning laheb kohtama perfektsionistist Adamiga. Talunik Chris toob kontoriassistent Dianele kingiks peete. Kehalise kasvatuse õpetaja Jude loodab leida armastuse varbaja Laureniga, kuid õnnetu juhus võib rikkuda nende sideme.

programme.title: Kodus ja võõrsil
programme.desc: Perril on oma erilisel paeval raskusi. Irene põletab sildu. John puuab oma parimat sõpra paasta.

programme.title: Igavene armastus
programme.desc: Emir suudistab Zeynepi Kemali kaitsmises. Zeynep puuab teda takistada, et Kemaliga midagi halba ei juhtuks. Emir kihutab minema ja kui Zeynep tanavale jookseb, saab ta autolt loogi. Emir viib Zeynepi haiglasse, kuid too kaotab lapse. Emir suudistab kõiges Kemali.

programme.title: Toidu ABC
programme.desc: "Toidu ABC-l" on missioon leida ules kõige ullatavamad faktid toidu kohta, mida me soome. Selles osas uurib Matt vaidet, et pudel ketšupit sisaldab rohkem tomateid kui pudelis on ketšupit; Kate selgitab valja, miks on austrid, mida Victoria-ajastul soodi naksidena, saanud rauakotiroovlist luksuskaubaks; ning Amanda paljastab, mis on keskmise suurusega ja suurte munade erinevus.

programme.title: Toidu ABC
programme.desc: "Toidu ABC" jatkab vasimatult põnevate toidufaktide valjaselgitamist selleks, et vaataja ei peaks seda tegema. Selles saates põikab Jimmy Prantsusmaale, et saada teada, millest koosneb Brie-juustu valge nahk; Helen sõidab linnast valja uurima, kuidas on suhkruvatt seotud teatud suurte murrangutega toidutoostuses; ja Briony selgitab valja, miks ei saa kõiki koorikloomi toidupoest terves tukis osta.

programme.title: Magidoktor
programme.desc: Martin seisab raske valiku ees: kas loobuda oma lapse hooldusõigusest või kaotada talu igakulgne sissetulek, mis viiks Gruberhofi pankroti aarele. Doktor Gruber testib auahnet ekstreemsportlast, kelle diagnoos osutub jalustrabavaks. Anne toetab Martinit, ent kardab samas ka iseenda eksistentsi parast. Kas Franziskal on võimalus koomast valja tulla?

programme.title: Magidoktor
programme.desc: Martin seisab raske valiku ees: kas loobuda oma lapse hooldusõigusest või kaotada talu igakulgne sissetulek, mis viiks Gruberhofi pankroti aarele.
